memberdef.argsstring: (FTIT_configuration *FTI_Conf, FTIT_execution *FTI_Exec, FTIT_topology *FTI_Topo, FTIT_checkpoint *FTI_Ckpt, char *checksum, char *ptnerChecksum, char *rsChecksum)
memberdef.name: FTI_GetChecksums

briefdescription.para: It gets the checksums from metadata.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
checksum
Pointer to fill the checkpoint checksum.
ptnerChecksum
Pointer to fill the ptner file checksum.
rsChecksum
Pointer to fill the RS file checksum.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function reads the metadata file created during checkpointing and recovers the checkpoint checksum. If there is no RS file, rsChecksum string length is 0.

memberdef.argsstring: (FTIT_configuration *FTI_Conf, FTIT_execution *FTI_Exec, FTIT_topology *FTI_Topo, FTIT_checkpoint *FTI_Ckpt, int rank, char *checksum)
memberdef.name: FTI_WriteRSedChecksum

briefdescription.para: It writes the RSed file checksum to metadata.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
rank
global rank of the process
checksum
Pointer to the checksum.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function should be executed only by one process per group. It writes the RSed checksum to the metadata file.

FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function reads the temporary metadata file created during checkpointing and recovers the checkpoint file name, file size, partner file size and the size of the largest file in the group (for padding if necessary during decoding).

briefdescription.para: It gets the metadata to recover the data after a failure.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function reads the metadata file created during checkpointing and recovers the checkpoint file name, file size, partner file size and the size of the largest file in the group (for padding if necessary during decoding).

briefdescription.para: Loads relevant data from checkpoint meta data.
Loads relevant data from checkpoint meta data.
Creates or updates checkpoint meta data.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
Writes checkpoint meta data in checkpoint meta data file.
timestamp
level
number of processes participating in the checkpoint
I/O mode
dCP enabled/disabled

memberdef.argsstring: (FTIT_configuration *FTI_Conf, FTIT_execution *FTI_Exec, FTIT_topology *FTI_Topo, FTIT_checkpoint *FTI_Ckpt, long *fs, long mfs, char *fnl, char *checksums, int *allVarIDs, long *allVarSizes, unsigned long *allLayerSizes, char *allLayerHashes, long *allVarPositions, char *allCharIds)
memberdef.name: FTI_WriteMetadata

briefdescription.para: It writes the metadata to recover the data after a failure.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
fs
Pointer to the list of checkpoint sizes.
mfs
The maximum checkpoint file size.
fnl
Pointer to the list of checkpoint names.
checksums
Checksums array.
allVarIDs
IDs of vars from all processes in group.
allVarSizes
Sizes of vars from all processes in group.
allLayerSizes
Sizes of all layers used in dcp.
allLayerHashes
Hashes of all layers used in dcp.
allVarPositions
Positions of variables stored in dCP.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function should be executed only by one process per group. It writes the metadata file used to recover in case of failure.

briefdescription.para: It writes the metadata to recover the data after a failure.

detaileddescription.para:
FTI_Conf
Configuration metadata.
FTI_Exec
Execution metadata.
FTI_Topo
Topology metadata.
FTI_Ckpt
Checkpoint metadata.
FTI_Data
Dataset metadata.
integer FTI_SCES if successful.
This function gathers information about the checkpoint files in the group (name and sizes), and creates the metadata file used to recover in case of failure.

briefdescription.para: Metadata functions for the FTI library.
